roleset.name: to add glyosyl radicals to a protein to form a glycoprotein
roleset.note: GLYCOSYLATE-V NOTES: (from glycosylate.01-v) Extended for Bio AMRs by Bianca and Ulf.

example.name: Arg0,1
example.text: They glycosylated insulin, complexed it with Con A, and retained the complex within a membrane capsule, which allowed glucose to diffuse in, disrupt the Con A-SAPG insulin complex, and release insulin, which diffuses out.

example.name: passivized form, with result
example.text: Also lipids can be glycosylated to form glycolipids, which are integral components of biological membranes.
example.arg: glycolipids, which are integral components of biological membranes

example.name: example with instrument
example.text: A hydroxyproline-containing class IV chitinase of sugar beet is glycosylated with xylose.
example.arg: A hydroxyproline-containing class IV chitinase of sugar beet
